couplet: To understand my words one must know silence,
For these words emerge from the womb of silence.
In self-exile, I speak to no one but you, beloved:
You who are the melodious voice of silence.
If truth needs to be confirmed by perception,
How am I to affirm your existence, O Silence?
Meditation is just another ritual, I am aware.
True piety is in the act of chanting silence.
Where perception fails, love lights the way.
The lantern of love is naught but flaming silence.
If death be near, I will embrace it with open arms.
Having lived it, why should I fear to die in silence?
Drunkards congregate in the noise of the tavern.
The wine they drink though is the wine of silence.
No rhyme or rhythm. What a strange poem!
But this is how life speaks, in the language of silence.
The word is behind the plight of these two tribes.
There are no distinctions in the religion of silence.
Darkness overpowers light in the dreamscape of life.
But where is the fault when you watch in silence?
Who is the one they are calling out to?
My name is but the meaning of the word "silence."
One must abandon hearing to listen for the truth.
My words are loud but they are disguised in silence.
If the flower withers, let autumn take the blame.
It emerged, after all, from the garden of silence.
Sound and form are illusory in their oneness.
What is emptiness but another term for silence!
The sparrows are perched on the passing cloud-sill.
At last, they have built an eternal nest in silence.
